H0.text: What word for a surprise attack originally referred to hiding in the woods. Skirmish

H1.text: What word for a surprise attack originally referred to hiding in the woods. Flank

H2.text: What word for a surprise attack originally referred to hiding in the woods. Raid

H3.text: What word for a surprise attack originally referred to hiding in the woods. Ambush

A4.text: Ambush is a surprise attack carried out by combatants waiting in a concealed (and typically well-defiladed) position against an approaching enemy individual or group.

A5.text: The term 'ambush' is also used in animal behavior studies to describe the predation strategy of some carnivores using stealth and deception (i.e. ambush predators), in sociology to describe aggressive journalistic practices (i.e. ambush journalism), and in economics to describe some marketing strategies (i.e. ambush marketing), all of which involve an element of surprise upon the recipients.
